intro: Adonis aestivalis var. pallida, commonly known as the pale spring beauty, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It features basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of delicate, pale yellow to white flowers in early spring. The plant is adapted to rocky and dry habitats, often found in open woodlands and meadows. Its flowers are typically 1–2 inches in diameter and have a distinctive, slightly nodding appearance. The pale coloration of its flowers and foliage is a key distinguishing feature of this variety.
